title: Soviet destroyer Uporny (1959)
text:
Uporny was the sixth ship of the of the <a href="Soviet%20Navy">Soviet Navy</a>.
Construction and career.
The ship was built at <a href="Mykolayiv%20Shipyard">North Nikolayev Shipyard</a> in <a href="Mykolaiv">Mykolaiv</a> and was <a href="Launched%20%28ship%29">launched</a> on 14 October 1959 and <a href="Commissioned%20%28ship%29">commissioned</a> into the <a href="Black%20Sea%20Fleet">Black Sea Fleet</a> on 3 December 1960.
In June 1961, after an inter-fleet passage from <a href="Sevastopol">Sevastopol</a> along the Northern Sea Route to <a href="Vladivostok">Vladivostok</a>, it became part of the <a href="Pacific%20Fleet%20%28Russia%29">Pacific Fleet</a> of the Soviet Navy. On 19 May 1966, she was reclassified into a large missile ship (BRK). In the period from 26 December 1967 to 22 March 1968, she underwent a major overhaul at Dalzavod Shipyard (Vladivostok).
In 1969, the destroyer carried out combat service in the <a href="Indian%20Ocean">Indian Ocean</a>, during this period made business calls to <a href="Zanzibar">Zanzibar</a> (<a href="Tanzania">Tanzania</a>), <a href="Mal%C3%A9">Malé</a> (<a href="Maldives">Maldives</a>), <a href="Umm%20Qasr">Umm Qasr</a> (<a href="Iraq">Iraq</a>), <a href="Bandar%20Abbas">Bandar Abbas</a> (<a href="Iran">Iran</a>) and <a href="Berbera">Berber</a> (<a href="Somalia">Somalia</a>). From April 25, 1970, to August 19, 1970, he took part in an exercise and carried out combat service in the Indian Ocean, made business calls to Berbera, Mogadishu, Umm Qasr, Bombay. August - October 1972 - military service in the Pacific Ocean, in the regions of <a href="Canada">Canada</a>, <a href="North%20America">North America</a> and <a href="Hawaii">Hawaii</a>. From 7 February 1977 to 3 February 1978, she was modernized and rebuilt at Dalzavod according to the project 57-A. August 3, 1977 reclassified as large anti-submarine ships.
On June 24, 1991, the destroyer was excluded from the combat composition of the Soviet Navy, disarmed and renamed to the "PKZ-12" after conversion into a floating barrack. On June 29, 1993, the floating barracks were excluded from the lists of the Navy ships in connection with the delivery to ARVI for dismantling and sale.
On September 7, 1995, "PKZ-12" was sold to an American company for cutting into metal.
